intro: Elatostema polycephalum, commonly known as the clustered false shamrock, is a small herbaceous plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are borne on short pedicels. Elatostema polycephalum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices.
